articles.title: ASML drags European stocks lower amid tariff worries
articles.body: German share price index DAX graph is pictured at the stock exchange in Frankfurt, Germany, July 14, 2025. REUTERS/Wolfgang Rattay/File Photo
articles.summary: European shares slipped on Wednesday, with ASML leading losses after a weak business update, while broader investor sentiment remained cautious on concerns over tariff-driven inflation following stronger-than-expected U.S. inflation data.
articles.author: Reuters

articles.title: Renault shares tumble 17% after guidance cut, interim CEO appointment
articles.body: The logo of Renault is seen on a car displayed at the ChangeNOW 2025 summit at the Grand Palais in Paris, France, April 25, 2025. REUTERS/Sarah Meyssonnier/File Photo
articles.summary: Shares in Renault plunged as much as 17% on Wednesday after the French carmaker lowered its 2025 guidance due to weaker-than-expected sales volumes in June and a challenging European market.
articles.author: Reuters

articles.title: World risks up to $39 trillion in economic losses from vanishing wetlands, report says
articles.summary: The world has lost 411 million hectares of wetlands, the equivalent of half a billion football pitches, and a quarter of the remaining wetlands are now classified as in a state of degradation, according to a report by the Convention on Wetlands.
articles.author: Duncan Miriri

articles.title: Ford recalls over 694,000 US vehicles over fire risk
articles.body: A Ford automobile logo is seen during the New York International Auto Show Press Preview in New York City, U.S., April 16, 2025. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton/File Photo
articles.summary: Ford is recalling 694,271 vehicles in the United States due to a fuel leak issue that could increase the risk of a fire, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.
articles.author: Reuters

articles.title: India IT demand outlook remains uncertain amid US tariff risks, says Wipro chair
articles.body: Figurines with computers and smartphones are seen in front of Wipro logo in this illustration taken, February 19, 2024. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo
articles.summary: The demand outlook for India's $283-billion IT sector remains uncertain due to U.S. tariff risks and global geopolitical factors, a senior Wipro executive said on Wednesday.
articles.author: Reuters

articles.title: Agreements between US, Indonesian firms in leadup to trade deal
articles.body: A drone view shows stacks of containers at the Tanjung Priok port in Jakarta, Indonesia, July 10, 2025. REUTERS/Ajeng Dinar Ulfiana/File photo
articles.summary: U.S. President Donald announced a trade agreement with Indonesia that would see Washington lower its tariff rates to 19% from a threatened 32%.
articles.author: Reuters

articles.title: Apollo in talks to take stake in Atletico Madrid, report says
articles.body: Soccer Football - LaLiga - Atletico Madrid v Rayo Vallecano - Metropolitano, Madrid, Spain - April 24, 2025 General view outside the stadium before the match REUTERS/Isabel Infantes/File Photo
articles.summary: U.S.-based buyout fund Apollo Global Management is in talks with the owner of Atletico Madrid to take a significant stake in the Spanish top-flight side, Expansion newspaper reported on Wednesday.
articles.author: Reuters

articles.title: Stellantis discontinues hydrogen fuel cell programme and van production
articles.body: Stellantis logo is pictured at one of its assembly plants following a company's announcement saying it will pause production there, in Toluca, state of Mexico, Mexico April 4, 2025. REUTERS/Henry Romero/File Photo
articles.summary: Carmaker Stellantis said on Wednesday it would discontinue its hydrogen fuel cell technology programme and no longer launch a range of hydrogen-powered vehicles this year, as it sees no development of the market in the mid-term.
articles.author: Reuters

articles.title: ECB's Nagel calls for 'steady hand' amid tariff turmoil
articles.body: President of the Deutsche Bundesbank Joachim Nagel speaks on measures to spur growth in the German economy at Humboldt University, Berlin, Germany, March 10, 2025. REUTERS/Liesa Johannssen/File Photo
articles.summary: European Central Bank policymaker Joachim Nagel said that a "steady hand" was required to deal with the uncertainty unleashed by U.S. President Donald Trump's latest tariff threat, in comments to business daily Handelsblatt.
articles.author: Reuters

articles.title: Nvidia's resumption of AI chips to China is part of rare earths talks, says US
articles.body: A smartphone with a displayed NVIDIA logo is placed on a computer motherboard in this illustration taken March 6, 2023. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration
articles.summary: Nvidia's planned resumption of sales of its H20 AI chips to China is part of U.S. negotiations on rare earths, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said, and comes days after its CEO met President Trump.
articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Karen Freifeld
